intro: Metastelma heterodontum, commonly known as the toothed metastelma, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or subshrub, often found in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a follicle that contains several seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
